chargeHist.descr: Deliver Cocaine within 1000 feet of park (>1-5g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos A. MIRANDA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
The State moves to delete all enhancers in count 1.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge in count 1 of deliver cocaine.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2.  Motion granted.
The Court orders that the daily reporting condition be amended to allow the defendant to report every Wednesday by 6:00 p.m.
Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.
Sentencing is set for 01-08-16 at 11:30 a.m.
Minutes.
Plea date at 12-01-2015 08:30 am
State's Motion in Limine.
State's proposed jury instructions.
Order Denying Motion to Modify Bail.

MOTION TO MODIFY BOND - 
Defense requests the daily reporting condition be lifted.  The State objects.
The Court feels the reporting condition is necessary due to there being a flight risk.  
The motion is denied.
State to draft order.
Minutes.
Motion to Modify Bond.
Motion hearing at 09-29-2015 09:15 am

Pretrial conference is set for 11-23-15 at 8:30 a.m.
Jury trial is set for 12-01-15 and 12-02-15 at 8:30 a.m. no: 1 position.
Status conference set for 06-25-15 at 1:45 p.m.

Status conference is set for 06-25-15 at 1:45 p.m.

Settlement conference with District Attorney reset to 04-23-2015 @ 10:00 a.m.
Order Denying Motion to Modify Bail.
State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Preliminary held.  Probable cause found.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT- 
Information filed. Defendant waives the reading of the Information.
Not guilty pleas entered to the charge contained in the Information.  Jury Calendar.
Settlement conference with the District Attorney set for 03-24-15 at 2:30 p.m.
MOTION TO MODIFY BAIL - 
The defendant moves to have the reporting condition eliminated. State objects.
Court finds that the condition is not unduly burdensome and denies the motion.
State to draft order.
Information.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-18-15 at 1:30 p.m.   
Minutes.
Amended Criminal Complaint amends the date in Count 2 to January 25, 2013.

Defendant in custody on arrest warrant.
The matter is continued for initial appearance on 02-09-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report daily to the Manitowoc County Jail by 7:00 p.m.  and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished.
